title: Harry Potter moving pictures become reality: Your photos 'come alive' with new iPhone technology
text:
Now you can capture Harry Potter -style moving pictures on your iPhone .
A new feature called "Live photos" was announced at this evening's iPhone 6s event .
The magical technology will take a second and a half’s worth of frames either side of your snap.
That means that when you press down on the picture, it will “come alive” and show you the motion around the captured moment.
Warner Bros Would these three use a new iPhone at Hogwarts?
"These are still photos, they're not videos," said Apple's Phil Schiller.
"But we extend the capture moment just before and just after you took it."
It’ll be supported on all your devices too - from Mac OSX El Capitan right down to the Apple Watch.
Phil Schiller shows off Live Photos at the Apple iPhone 6s event
You can even set a Live Photo as your Apple Watch face.
"Every time you raise your arm, it comes alive as it's telling you the time. This is amazing," said Schiller.
